doc.title: penncnv

description.text: CNV detection from Illumina whole-genome SNP genotyping arrays. It has been extended to handle candidate gene SNP arrays, to handle recent high-density arrays with non-polymorphic markers (so-called CN markers), and to handle Affymetrix genome-wide arrays.

doc.reference: Wang K, Li M, Hadley D, Liu R, Glessner J, Grant S, Hakonarson H, Bucan M. PennCNV: an integrated hidden Markov model designed for high-resolution copy number variation detection in whole-genome SNP genotyping data Genome Research 17:1665-1674, 2007

Diskin SJ, Li M, Hou C, Yang S, Glessner J, Hakonarson H, Bucan M, Maris JM, Wang K. Adjustment of genomic waves in signal intensities from whole-genome SNP genotyping platforms Nucleic Acids Research 36:e126, 2008
Wang K, Chen Z, Tadesse MG, Glessner J, Grant SFA, Hakonarson H, Bucan M, Li M. Modeling genetic inheritance of copy number variations Nucleic Acids Research 36:e138, 2008

description.text: Scan genomic regions in a query-file against a DB-file which contains chromosome locations for various genomics features

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: A file containing CNV calls, that could be generated by the test operation of detect_cnv program.

interface.label: Reference genes for CNV calls generated using hg18 (Mar 2006, NCBI build 36) human genome assembly Choose a Reference genes databases UCSC refGene Annotation UCSC knownGene Annotation

Flags specifying type of databases?
Choose a flags specifying type of databases Database is UCSC refGene annotation file Database is UCSC refGene with exon annotation Database is UCSC refGene with coding sequence annotation Database is UCSC knownGene annotation file
--refgene: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser.
--refcds: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser, but user is only interested in the overlap of coding region (first exon to last exon).
--refexon: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser, but user is only interested in the overlap of query with exons.
--knowngene: specify that the database file is in knownGene format from UCSC genome browser.

xhtml:div.label:
Use name2 annotation in refGene file in output?
Yes No
This argument is used in conjunction with the --refgene argument, to specify that the alternative gene symbol in the "name2" field in the refGene file be printed in the output.

Specify a cross-reference file for the RefGene track in UCSC genome browser?
Yes No
Specify a cross-reference file for the RefGene track in UCSC genome browser, so that in the output, the gene identifier (gene name or refseq id) are replaced by the gene symbol specified in the link file. (If not found in the reflink file, the gene identifiers are still used).

Specify a cross-reference file for the knownGene track in UCSC genome browser?
Yes No
Specify a cross-reference file for the knownGene track in UCSC genome browser, so that in the output, the gene identifier (gene name or refseq id) are replaced by the gene symbol specified in the kgxref file. (If not found in the kgxref file, the gene identifiers are still used).

Condense and eliminate overlapping regions in query?
Yes No
Condense overlapped regions in the query file into non-over-lapped regions. When this argument is set, the annotation for each query (the strings after the chromosome location in each line of the query file) will not in the output.

Score threshold for database in UCSC annotation file?
Specify the score threshold in the database file to include in the search for overlaps. This argument is file format dependent.

Normalized score threshold for database in UCSC annotation file?
Specify the normalized score threshold in the database file to include in the search for overlaps. This argument is file format dependent.

fieldset.legend: Expansion of query to find match

xhtml:div.label:
Expand left side of query regions (overwrite --expandmax)?
Expand the query region on the left side (5 megabases in forward strand, 3 megabases in reverse strand) to find overlap (used in conjunction with --refgene or --knowngene argument).

Expand right side of query regions (overwrite --expandmax)?
Expand the query region on the right side (3 megabases in forward strand, 5 megabases in reverse strand) to find overlap (used in conjunction with --refgene or --knowngene argument).

Size of maximum expansion for query region to find overlap?
Maximum expansion size of the query region on both side to find at least one overlap (used in junction with --refgene or --knowngene argument). After query expansion, only the closet gene will be printed; other genes, even if overlapping with the query after expansion, will not be printed.

interface.label:
Expand definition of gene/cds/exon at both sides?
Expand the chromosome region specified in the database-file to find overlap with the query regions.

xhtml:div.label:
Print overlapped portion of region only?
Yes No
Instead of printing the query region, only print the overlapped portion of the query region and template region.

Print database region (default is to print query region)?
Yes No
Print the region in database file, rather than query file, when an overlapped hit is found.

Append extra information from annotation file to output?
Yes No
Append the score and normscore for the overlapped template region to the output for database files downloaded as UCSC tables.
Force to print query info when Print database region is used Yes No

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: A file containing CNV calls, that could be generated by the test operation of detect_cnv program.
--refgene: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser.
--refcds: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser, but user is only interested in the overlap of coding region (first exon to last exon).
--refexon: specify that the database file is in refGene format from UCSC genome browser, but user is only interested in the overlap of query with exons.
--knowngene: specify that the database file is in knownGene format from UCSC genome browser.
This argument is used in conjunction with the --refgene argument, to specify that the alternative gene symbol in the "name2" field in the refGene file be printed in the output.

Specify a cross-reference file for the RefGene track in UCSC genome browser, so that in the output, the gene identifier (gene name or refseq id) are replaced by the gene symbol specified in the link file. (If not found in the reflink file, the gene identifiers are still used).

Specify a cross-reference file for the knownGene track in UCSC genome browser, so that in the output, the gene identifier (gene name or refseq id) are replaced by the gene symbol specified in the kgxref file. (If not found in the kgxref file, the gene identifiers are still used).

Condense overlapped regions in the query file into non-over-lapped regions. When this argument is set, the annotation for each query (the strings after the chromosome location in each line of the query file) will not in the output.
Specify the score threshold in the database file to include in the search for overlaps. This argument is file format dependent.
Specify the normalized score threshold in the database file to include in the search for overlaps. This argument is file format dependent.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Expand the query region on the left side (5 megabases in forward strand, 3 megabases in reverse strand) to find overlap (used in conjunction with --refgene or --knowngene argument).
Expand the query region on the right side (3 megabases in forward strand, 5 megabases in reverse strand) to find overlap (used in conjunction with --refgene or --knowngene argument).

Maximum expansion size of the query region on both side to find at least one overlap (used in junction with --refgene or --knowngene argument). After query expansion, only the closet gene will be printed; other genes, even if overlapping with the query after expansion, will not be printed.
Expand the chromosome region specified in the database-file to find overlap with the query regions.
Instead of printing the query region, only print the overlapped portion of the query region and template region.
Print the region in database file, rather than query file, when an overlapped hit is found.
Append the score and normscore for the overlapped template region to the output for database files downloaded as UCSC tables.
